meanings.definition: Suffering from an illness or disease.
meanings.sent1: The ailed patient rested in bed.
meanings.sent3: The ailed puppy wore a tiny cone around its neck.
meanings.sent4: The ailed flower drooped in the heat.
meanings.sent5: The ailed child's pale face showed the severity of the illness.

meanings.definition: To cause pain or trouble to.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise ailed my ears.
meanings.sent2: The bitter cold ailed the hikers' exposed skin.
meanings.sent3: The broken shoelace ailed the runner's progress.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories ailed her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sharp criticism ailed his confidence.

meanings.sent1: The student ailed over the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: The worried mother ailed about her missing child.
meanings.sent3: The ailing car refused to start on a cold morning.
meanings.sent4: The ailing relationship needed attention to thrive.
meanings.sent5: The ailing economy caused widespread concern among citizens.
